description: The content of the textarea.
The minimum number of rows to display.
Maximum number of rows up to which the textarea can grow.
Reuse previously computed measurements when computing height of textarea.
The variant of the textarea.

type: default | primary | secondary | success | warning | danger
description: The color of the textarea.
The size of the textarea.
The radius of the textarea.
The content to display as the label.
The current value of the textarea (controlled).
The default value of the textarea (uncontrolled).
The placeholder of the textarea.
Element to be rendered in the left side of the input.
Element to be rendered in the right side of the input.
A description for the textarea. Provides a hint such as specific requirements for what to choose.
An error message for the textarea.
Validate input values when committing (e.g. on blur), returning error messages for invalid values.
Whether to use native HTML form validation or ARIA validation. When wrapped in a Form component, the default is `aria`. Otherwise, the default is `native`.
The position of the label.
Whether the textarea should take up the width of its parent.
Whether user input is required on the textarea before form submission.
Whether the textarea can be selected but not changed by the user.
Whether the textarea is disabled.
Whether the textarea should have a clear button.
Whether the textarea is invalid.
Whether the textarea should display its "valid" or "invalid" visual styling. (Deprecated) use isInvalid instead.
Whether the textarea auto vertically resize should be disabled.
Whether the textarea should be animated.
Allows to set custom class names for the checkbox slots.
